Nightshift looks at the computer module and sits in front of it.

" I know.=
  Computer, identify all alterations in your configuration and identify the=
 programmer.  Bypass all satellite channels and convert ta in house text pa=
nels . " 

Don't be envious of what you don't have, be grateful for things =
you already posses.  Nothing is worth more than family and friends.

On Dec=
 21, 2011, at 12:22 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> =
> <OLD>
> >
> > Nightshift backs away from the computer and then looks at h=
is paw pad.
> >
> > " I wonder if it's look'n for some ID? Lemme see. "
> >=

> > He places his paw on a scanner board and waits to see what happens.
> =

> "Identifying." The computer said as small holographic image of
> NIGHTSH=
IFT appeared above the board. "Nightshift. Maximal." The
> computer returne=
d. However the image was of NIGHTSHIFT in his
> vehicular configuration.
> =

> "Updating." The computer said as the picture changed into NIGHTSHIFT's
>=
 current configuration with his feline mode. "Updating complete."
> 
> "Sen=
ding signal" The computer said again. The signal went up,
> communicated wi=
th the satellite, but there was no answering reply.
> 
> PROWL grunted. "I =
can see that the satellite received the messages."
> he said as he pointed =
to the computer indications. "But its like it is
> just choosing not to res=
pond."
> 
> "Now what?" WOLFGANG said. "We got to go up there and fix on th=
at too?"
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> - Preston
> 

--Apple-Mail-7BDF60EC-0F16-44FA-858C-2A1EE630E44D

e places his paw on a scanner board and waits to see what happens.<br>

"Identifying." The computer said as  small holographic image of<br>
NIGHTS=
HIFT appeared above the board. "Nightshift. Maximal." The<br>
computer retu=
rned. However the image was of NIGHTSHIFT in his<br>

n.<br>
<br>
"Updating." The computer said as the picture changed into NIGHT=
SHIFT's<br>
current configuration with his feline mode. "Updating complete.=

<br>
"Sending signal" The computer said again. The signal went up,<br=

communicated with the satellite, but there was no answering reply.<br>
<b=
r>
PROWL grunted. "I can see that the satellite received the messages."<br>=

he said as he pointed to the computer indications. "But its like it is<br>=

just choosing not to respond."<br>
<br>
"Now what?" WOLFGANG said. "We got=
 to go up there and fix on that too?"<br>
